title: SpaceX Starship test flight 7 explodes: What went wrong with Elon Musk's rocket? - Hindustan Times
summary:
SpaceX Starship Test Flight 7 Explodes: What Went Wrong with Elon Musk's Rocket?

Date: January 17, 2025 | Source: Hindustan Times

SpaceX's Starship rocket exploded just minutes into its seventh test flight, marking an unexpected setback for the company as it continued to advance the vehicle's capabilities.

  • The Starship rocket exploded eight minutes after liftoff from South Texas, carrying mock satellites and no crew.
  • Preliminary indications suggest the explosion was due to an oxygen leak above the engine firewall.
  • The incident caused disruptions to airline flights over the Gulf of Mexico due to falling debris.
  • Elon Musk indicated that this failure will prompt reviews to prevent future occurrences, including the addition of fire suppression systems.
  • This was the seventh Starship test since 2023 as part of a broader objective to enable human and cargo missions to Mars.
“Preliminary indication is that we had an oxygen/fuel leak in the cavity above the ship engine firewall that was large enough to build pressure in excess of the vent capacity.” - Elon Musk

The explosion represents a significant setback for SpaceX, yet Musk remains optimistic about conducting a new launch soon, aiming to avoid similar failures.
newTitle: SpaceX Starship Test Flight 7 Explodes: Details on the Incident

title: Indus Towers Share Price: CLSA adds another stock to its 'high-conviction outperform' list - CNBCTV18
summary:
CLSA Adds Indus Towers to 'High-Conviction Outperform' List

Date: Jan 17, 2025
Source: CNBCTV18

Indus Towers Ltd. shares are poised for attention as global brokerage CLSA has included the stock in its 'high-conviction outperformance' list with a newly set price target of ₹575 per share, the highest among analysts.

  • CLSA maintains an 'outperform' rating for Indus Towers.
  • The company's overdue payments from Vodafone Idea have decreased by over 70%.
  • CLSA notes that lower overdues bolster confidence in future 4G/5G network investments.
  • Indus Towers projects a 10% CAGR in EBITDA and a 7% FCF yield by FY 2027.
  • Separately, UBS upgraded Indus Towers to 'Buy' with a price target of ₹425.
  • Of 24 analysts covering the stock, 13 recommend 'Buy', five 'Sell', and six 'Neutral'.
  • Indus Towers shares fell 0.77% to ₹354.50 on the previous day, but have risen 68% in the last year.
"Lower overdues are adding confidence to planned 4G/5G network investments," CLSA.

This inclusion by CLSA, along with positive analyst actions, could signal favorable prospects for Indus Towers as it navigates its financial landscape.
newTitle: CLSA Adds Indus Towers to 'High-Conviction Outperform' List

title: Infosys CEO asked about low salary hikes, toxic work culture. His response - Hindustan Times
summary:
Infosys CEO Addresses Salary Hikes and Work Culture Concerns

Date: January 17, 2025

Source: Hindustan Times

Infosys CEO Salil Parekh addressed employee concerns about the company's toxic work culture during the Q3 earnings call, emphasizing fair treatment amid allegations of low salaries.

  • Infosys reported a fiscal third quarter profit of ₹6,806 crore, up 11.46% YoY.
  • Parekh responded to allegations of insufficient salary hikes and a poor work culture during the earnings call.
  • Concerns escalated after comments from founder Narayana Murthy about young employees working excessive hours.
  • Many former employees have accused Infosys of underpaying staff, particularly fresh graduates.
  • Parekh insists that Infosys maintains a fair treatment policy for all employees.
  • The company is on track to hire around 15,000 freshers in FY25.
“In terms of the employee question, within Infosys we have a very clear approach to make sure that everyone is treated fairly.” - Salil Parekh

The discussion highlights ongoing challenges at Infosys concerning employee satisfaction, attracting new talent, and maintaining a positive work environment.
newTitle: Infosys CEO Addresses Salary Hikes and Work Culture Concerns

title: SpaceX Starship destroyed during 7th test flight; Elon Musk reacts, posts video - Hindustan Times
summary:
SpaceX Starship destroyed during 7th test flight; Elon Musk reacts, posts video

Date: January 17, 2025

Source: Hindustan Times

SpaceX experienced a setback during its seventh test mission of the Starship rocket when contact was lost about eight minutes into the flight, leading to the destruction of the spacecraft. This test represented the first for the upgraded Starship this year.

  • The Starship lifted off from Boca Chica, Texas, on January 17, 2025, at 5:38 PM EST.
  • SpaceX lost contact eight minutes into the flight after the rocket separated from its Super Heavy booster.
  • CEO Elon Musk shared a video of the debris falling and remarked that 'entertainment is guaranteed.'
  • The mission involved testing 10 dummy satellites intended to be released in orbit.
  • This marked the first operational flight of the upgraded Starship.
"We did lose all communications with the ship - that is essentially telling us we had an anomaly with the upper stage." - Dan Huot, SpaceX Communications Manager

This test flight highlights the ongoing challenges SpaceX faces in achieving reliable space travel, as well as the ambitious goals set forth by Elon Musk for future missions.
newTitle: SpaceX Starship Destroyed in Latest Test Flight

title: Infosys ADR falls 6% overnight post Q3 results, will Indian shares follow suit? - CNBCTV18
summary:
Infosys ADR falls 6% overnight post Q3 results, will Indian shares follow suit?

Date: Jan 17, 2025
Source: CNBC TV18

The American Depository Receipts (ADRs) of Infosys fell 6% overnight following their December quarter results. Despite an upward revision of revenue guidance, shares witnessed a decline.

  • Infosys revised its revenue growth guidance for FY25 from 3.75%–4.5% to 4.5%–5%.
  • EBIT margin guidance remains unchanged at 20% to 22%.
  • Infosys shares also fell 1.5% in the Indian market before earnings announcement.
  • Organic Services revenue decreased by 0.9% sequentially.
  • Revenue from Infosys' top five clients decreased by 6.4% sequentially in USD terms.
  • Attrition rate rose to 13.7%.
  • Infosys won $2.5 billion in deals for the quarter, but Total Contract Value is down 32% year-on-year.
“The management spoke of impending wage hikes that will impact margins in the upcoming quarter.”

Despite a recovery in deals won, the overall figures reflect declining performance, prompting concerns about future growth.
newTitle: Infosys ADR falls 6% overnight post Q3 results, will Indian shares follow suit?

title: Gold price surpasses $2,700 as Fed’s Waller turns dovish - FXStreet
summary:
Gold Price Surpasses $2,700 as Fed’s Waller Turns Dovish

Date: January 10, 2025 | Source: FXStreet

Gold prices surged above $2,700 as the market responded to a combination of weaker retail sales and dovish remarks from Fed Governor Christopher Waller, suggesting potential rate cuts.

  • Gold rallies driven by disappointing US retail sales and rising jobless claims.
  • Fed's Waller indicates that the Central Bank might lower rates sooner if disinflation continues.
  • The current price of Gold (XAU/USD) is $2,715, marking a 0.72% increase.
  • Initial Jobless Claims reported an unexpected increase to 217K, impacting the US Dollar negatively.
  • Economic outlook remains uncertain, with traders watching upcoming housing data.
“If the disinflation process evolves, we could lower borrowing costs sooner and faster,” said Fed Governor Waller.

This rally in Gold reflects broader economic anxieties and investor sentiment leaning towards safe-haven assets amid fluctuating economic data.
newTitle: Gold Price Surpasses $2,700 Following Dovish Fed Remarks

title: Hindenburg, which dealt Adani a $140bn m-cap blow, to disband - The Times of India
summary:
Hindenburg to Disband After Impacting Adani's Market Value by $140 Billion

Publication Date: October 2023   Source: Times of India

The investigative firm Hindenburg, known for its critical reports on major corporations, has announced its decision to disband. This decision follows the fallout after their report on the Adani Group, which resulted in a staggering $140 billion drop in market capitalization.

  • Hindenburg's report accused the Adani Group of stock manipulation and accounting fraud.
  • The impact led to heightened scrutiny of corporate governance in India.
  • Adani Group has vehemently denied the allegations made by Hindenburg.
  • The disbandment reflects the controversial nature of Hindenburg's investigative practices.
"The consequences of our findings have created a wave of skepticism regarding corporate practices in India," commented a spokesperson for Hindenburg.

The Hindenburg case highlights the profound effects that investigative journalism can have on global business practices and raises concerns about corporate transparency.
newTitle: Hindenburg to Disband After Impacting Adani's Market Value by $140 Billion

Private sector lender Axis Bank reported a net profit of Rs 6,303.77 crore for the December 2024 quarter, reflecting a 3.83% increase compared to Rs 6,071.1 crore in the previous year.

  • The bank's gross non-performing assets ratio stood at 1.46% at the end of December, slightly up from 1.44% in the previous quarter.

title: India to remain fastest-growing large economy in FY26, FY27: World Bank - Business Standard
summary:
India to remain fastest-growing large economy in FY26, FY27: World Bank

Publication Date: October 2023

Source: World Bank

The World Bank predicts that India will maintain its position as the fastest-growing major economy for the next two fiscal years, with a growth forecast unchanged at 6.7% for FY26.

  • The services sector is expected to expand steadily.
  • Manufacturing activity is projected to strengthen due to government initiatives.
  • India's private consumption is likely to see growth driven by a strengthening labor market.
  • Growth forecast for India's economy is expected to decelerate to 6.5% in 2024-25.
  • Heightened policy uncertainty poses a downside risk for the South Asian region.
“The next 25 years will be a tougher slog for developing economies than the last 25.” - Indermit Gill, World Bank’s Chief Economist.

Overall, India's economy is set to navigate through a period of challenges while remaining a leading growth engine in the global economy.
newTitle: India Remains the Fastest-Growing Major Economy According to World Bank

title: Stock exchanges ban fresh F&O positions in Kalyan Jewellers - Mint
summary:
Stock Exchanges Prohibit New F&O Positions in Kalyan Jewellers

Publication Date: [Insert Publication Date] | Source: [Insert Source]

India’s stock exchanges have banned fresh trading of Kalyan Jewellers Ltd’s stock futures and options contracts after trader positions approached regulatory limits, following a significant decline in the company's market capitalisation.

The ban comes after Kalyan Jewellers’ share price fell significantly, despite management attempts to mitigate investor concerns.

  • The company’s share price dropped 32% from a record high of ₹795.4 on January 2 to ₹539.
  • The traders had significant open interest in Kalyan Jewellers’ contracts, nearing 95% of the market-wide position limit.
  • Management assured investors that business operations remained normal despite the stock price decline.
  • Kalyan Jewellers has received mixed ratings from analysts, with five ‘buy’ recommendations.
“Management vehemently denied all rumors regarding impropriety during an analyst call.”

The F&O ban will remain until trading positions fall below the 80% marketwide limit. This situation is critical for investors as market sentiments fluctuate amid regulatory concerns.
newTitle: Stock Exchanges Prohibit New F&O Positions in Kalyan Jewellers

  • Trump's transition team is evaluating pro-crypto executive orders.
